questions.explanation:
7. Where can I buy tickets for the orchestra's fund-raiser?
(A) Over the next week. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)
(B) On the fifth floor. → Correct (specifies the ticket purchase location)
(C) I suppose; if you want to. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. How long does your commute take?
(A) The gym opens early. → Incorrect (unrelated to commute time)
(B) I've been working here since March. → Incorrect (refers to employment duration, not commute)
(C) About an hour lately. → Correct (specifies the commute duration)

9. What's good to order at this café?
(A) I recommend the coffee and baked goods. → Correct (suggests specific menu items)
(B) Your food is on the way. → Incorrect (unrelated to recommendations)
(C) It was sent this morning. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

10. When's the new office furniture going to be delivered?
(A) At the end of the report. → Incorrect (unrelated to delivery time)
(B) I already finished the revision. → Incorrect (irrelevant to furniture delivery)
(C) It'll be here next week. → Correct (specifies the delivery time)

11. Who's holding the training session on Thursday?
(A) Marcela's leading it. → Correct (identifies the session leader)
(B) exercise regularly. → Incorrect (unrelated to the training session)
(C) He was late today. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

12. When should we hire extra help for the holidays?
(A) A helpful assistant. → Incorrect (refers to a person, not timing)
(B) A fun party. → Incorrect (unrelated to hiring)
(C) As soon as possible. → Correct (specifies the hiring timeline)

13. Why did you pick the color green for the product packaging?
(A) Because it matches our uniforms. → Correct (explains the reason for the color choice)
(B) I will pick it up tomorrow. → Incorrect (unrelated to color choice)
(C) Not until we know the menu options. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

14. When's the budget report due?
(A) Sounds too expensive. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not due date)
(B) By end of day on Friday. → Correct (specifies the due date)
(C) I can pay you back tomorrow. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

15. Which shopping bag should I bring?
(A) Just outside the store. → Incorrect (refers to location, not bag type)
(B) The large one. → Correct (specifies the bag to bring)
(C) No, it isn't. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

16. Don't forget to add another table to the conference room.
(A) Probably the yoga class. → Incorrect (unrelated to the table request)
(B) No, they didn't. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the request)
(C) OK, I'll do that now. → Correct (acknowledges the task)

17. Who from our office is going to the conference?
(A) I am enjoying our new assignment. → Incorrect (unrelated to conference attendees)
(B) At the hotel downtown. → Incorrect (refers to location, not people)
(C) Leslie and her support staff. → Correct (identifies the attendees)

18. Where are the signs for the sale?
(A) We are advertising a fifteen percent discount. → Incorrect (refers to sale details, not sign location)
(B) On the porch. → Correct (specifies the sign location)
(C) I didn't know we had sold those items. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

19. Do you think we should place an advertisement in the newspaper?
(A) That's not what happened. → Incorrect (unrelated to the advertisement)
(B) No, I already have a subscription. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the decision)
(C) Our budget is quite limited this month. → Correct (provides a reason against the advertisement)

20. I don't remember where I put my copy of the contract.
(A) My calendar is up-to-date. → Incorrect (unrelated to the contract)
(B) I can look around for it. → Correct (offers help to find the contract)
(C) I don't think that's the best idea. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

21. What should we order for dinner?
(A) Yes, I ate some of that yesterday. → Incorrect (unrelated to dinner suggestion)
(B) I'd like something we haven't tried before. → Correct (suggests a dinner option)
(C) That makes sense to me. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)

22. I thought the new safety training was supposed to start tomorrow.
(A) Yes, you're right. → Correct (confirms the training start date)
(B) An old computer. → Incorrect (unrelated to the training)
(C) The ones on the counter. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

23. Should we buy desktop computers or laptops for the office?
(A) The Web site is working now. → Incorrect (unrelated to the computer choice)
(B) You can buy them at any store. → Incorrect (refers to purchase location, not type)
(C) Most of our staff travel a lot. → Correct (implies laptops are better due to travel)

24. Will you be attending the reception tomorrow?
(A) Just another day or so. → Incorrect (refers to time, not attendance)
(B) Can you remind me what the topic is? → Correct (implies interest in attending)
(C) I heard that they ran out of them. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

25. Did you buy your ticket to the baseball game?
(A) Sure, after the game is over. → Incorrect (unrelated to ticket purchase)
(B) I thought admission was free. → Correct (explains why ticket wasn’t bought)
(C) A sports tournament. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

26. How can I get more information about the employee party?
(A) A phone number is included in the invitation. → Correct (provides a way to get information)
(B) The chef is from Italy. → Incorrect (unrelated to getting information)
(C) Where is the employment office? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

27. Could you show me how to transfer funds?
(A) No, it’s the other one. → Incorrect (unrelated to transferring funds)
(B) Let me just finish this first. → Correct (delays this answer)
(C) Sure, that seems like a reasonable price. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

28. Will our gym memberships renew automatically?
(A) They just saw that. → Incorrect (unrelated to membership renewal)
(B) About our manager. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) That’s what I was told. → Correct (confirms the renewal policy)

29. Isn't Shinji scheduled to work at the cash register?
(A) Yes, he just arrived. → Correct (confirms Shinji’s schedule)
(B) The price hasn’t changed. → Incorrect (unrelated to the schedule)
(C) How much does it cost? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

30. Do you have all the ingredients for the recipe?
(A) We will plant a garden soon. → Incorrect (unrelated to the recipe)
(B) Yes, my oven is working again. → Incorrect (mentions oven but not ingredients)
(C) I need to buy some onions. → Correct (indicates missing ingredients)

31. You're in charge of the supplier discount program, right?
(A) The coupons are on the kitchen counter. → Incorrect (refers to coupons, not responsibility)
(B) We have all the supplies we need. → Incorrect (unrelated to program responsibility)
(C) Horatio is the one you want to talk to. → Correct (identifies the correct person)
